markdownRemark.html:
In a recent discussion between Ben Horowitz and Tim Ferris, Horowitz, promoting his new book, What You Do Is Who You Are, notes that:

A culture is not a set of beliefs, it’s a set of actions.

  • Culture is paramount to startup employees
  • Not only attempting to dent the universe through your work
  • Get to shape and contribute to the vehicle of delivery
  • A certain naiveté is potentially required for SU employees

And that has to be across every dimension of the culture - you have to kind of program it in. Or, you are not going to have it. You’re going to talk it.

You have to set these kinds of things in place if you are really going to live up to your ideals.

Or you are not going to have it You’re gonna talk it If you talk it, and don’t do it, then your culture becomes your hypocrisy
